column4: Samba is one of those things thats worth learning :) I reread 'using samba' last night. and learned a few new things..
Your smart; I'll ask you.  If a group (var-wwww) owns a directory, how do I make it so that any files created in that folder (by users in the group) are owned by the user and group var-www?
groups and masks like that are somthing ive rarely used.  Like you mentioned - i did see that option for samba shares.. Not sure how it is done for normal dirs.
Bah, I'll just copy it up to my home dir and copy it over again.  It's what I've been doing.
heh. Ive rarely had users creating web content. so never looked into that stuff.
I am the user, and was just hoping to avoid another cp
I shut down root ssh, or I'd just sudo it from here
I hadn't checked if he was the only one in here like that...
dolphin is the new file manager for kde4.

mysql-server mysql-client libmysqlclient15-dev for isntance gives me:   libmysqlclient15-dev: Depends: zlib1g-dev but it is not installable and then mysql-client and mysql-server won't go.  Is this common for gutsy installs on onlder hardware?
i would have to suggest 'sudo apt-get update'  'sudo apt-get upgrade' and try installing the packages again. first. Harware dosent matter for this stuff
remember me?  I did updates, upgrades, and sitll can't sudo apt-get install mysql-server mysql-client.  Says there are unmet dependencies
Its possible that file it watns is missing form the servers or some other oddity. Im using hardy here. so cant test for you. You might want to try changing the apt sources to another server.
I did try that (read on some forums) but it won't play.  Are there extra packages I need besides audacious?
no idea. proberly depends on what site you are doing.
I came off fedora, so I was used to being root.  It must always get mentioned after I leave.
